description: The round payoff this round was 98. You, Kate chose to play option 1.John chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 49.
Mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) maximizes individual and joint payoffs, as seen in the 2024-01-02 round where both received 49
The game has two Nash equilibria (mutual option 1 or mutual option 2), but mutual option 1 is Pareto optimal, incentivizing coordination
Unilateral defection (choosing option 2) reduces the defector’s payoff compared to mutual cooperation, despite yielding a higher share than the cooperator in asymmetric cases
Repeated interactions with revealed actions enable trust-building, as cooperation in prior rounds (e.g., 2024-01-02) signals mutual benefit
The payoff structure penalizes mismatched actions, discouraging unilateral deviations from cooperation
